thread.title: Chargers Make New Changes to Roster
thread.title_full: Chargers Make New Changes to Roster

author: ANDIE ADAMS
title: Chargers Make New Changes to Roster
text: Get the latest Chargers news, scores, game photos, highlights, rumors and roster information Chargers Make New Changes to Roster Privacy Policy | More Newsletters Getty Images SANTA CLARA, CA - SEPTEMBER 03: Jarryd Hayne #38 of the San Francisco 49ers is tackled by Adrian Phillips #31 of the San Diego Chargers during their NFL preseason game at Levi's Stadium on September 3, 2015 in Santa Clara, California. (Photo by Ezra Shaw/Getty Images) Ahead of their matchup against the Oakland Raiders Sunday, the San Diego Chargers are making some changes to their roster. The team signed safety Adrian Phillips to the active roster Tuesday and brought on defensive lineman Chuka Ndulue for the practice squad. Phillips, standing 5-foot-11-inches and weighing 210 pounds, has appeared in three games after he started this season on the practice squad. He registered six tackles with one tackle for loss, the Chargers say. On Oct. 12, he was waved to make room for tight-end Antonio Gates before Week 5, when he was signed back to the practice squad. Ndulue most recently played with the Denver Broncos. Standing 6-foot-3-inches and weighing 289 pounds, he signed with Denver as an undrafted rookie free agent out of Oklahoma. There, he had appeared in 45 games, totaled 140 tackles, 17 tackles for loss and 12 sacks. During the preseason with the Broncos, he played all defensive line positions and registered half a sack. He was released from Denver's practice squad on Sept. 22. Published 2 hours ago
